not tracked not covered covered 
package filters

import (
        "os"
        "time"
)

// After holds a time.Time
type After struct {
        value time.Time
}

// IsOK returns true if value occured after After
func (a After) IsOK(file os.FileInfo) bool {
        if (a.value == time.Time{}) {
                return true
        }
        return file.ModTime().After(a.value)
}

// NewAfter returns a new instance of After
func NewAfter(value time.Time) After {
        return After{
                value: value,
        }
}

package filters

import (
        "os"
        "strings"
)

// Any holds a slice of values
type Any struct {
        values []string
}

// IsOK returns true if the value is in Any
func (a Any) IsOK(file os.FileInfo) bool {
        if (len(a.values)) == 0 {
                return true
        }
        for _, needle := range a.values {
                if strings.Contains(absFilePath(file), needle) {
                        return true
                }
        }
        return false
}

// NewAny returns a new instance of Any
func NewAny(values []string) Any {
        return Any{
                values: values,
        }
}

package filters

import (
        "os"
        "time"
)

// Before holds a time.Time
type Before struct {
        value time.Time
}

// IsOK returns true if value occured before Before
func (b Before) IsOK(file os.FileInfo) bool {
        if (b.value == time.Time{}) {
                return true
        }
        return file.ModTime().Before(b.value)
}

// NewBefore returns a new instance of Before
func NewBefore(value time.Time) Before {
        return Before{
                value: value,
        }
}

package filters

import (
        "os"
        "path/filepath"
)

// Filter holds a slice of Filterers
type Filter struct {
        filters []Filterer
}

// Add adds a Filterer to Filter
func (f *Filter) Add(filter Filterer) {
        f.filters = append(f.filters, filter)
}

// IsOK returns true if all Filterers IsOK's return true
func (f Filter) IsOK(file os.FileInfo) bool {
        for _, f := range f.filters {
                if !f.IsOK(file) {
                        return false
                }
        }
        return true
}

// NewFilter returns a new instance of Filter
func NewFilter() Filter {
        return Filter{}
}

// absFilePath returns the absolute file path of a file
func absFilePath(file os.FileInfo) string {
        path, _ := filepath.Abs(file.Name())
        return path
}

package filters

import (
        "os"
        "strings"
)

// None holds a slice of values
type None struct {
        values []string
}

// IsOK returns true if the value is not in None
func (n None) IsOK(file os.FileInfo) bool {
        if (len(n.values)) == 0 {
                return true
        }
        for _, needle := range n.values {
                if strings.Contains(absFilePath(file), needle) {
                        return false
                }
        }
        return true
}

// NewNone returns a new instance of None
func NewNone(values []string) None {
        return None{
                values: values,
        }
}
